original: 1.A.     INTRODUCTION.
ollama_generated:
1.A.     INTRODUCTION.

In the event that either Party hereto fails to perform any of its obligations or covenants under this Agreement without reasonable cause for such failure, the other Party shall not be obligated to mitigate damages or seek alternative means of performance in response thereto. Instead, it shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon giving written notice to the defaulting Party, and without prejudice to any other rights or remedies which may be available under applicable law or otherwise.

This provision is intended to clarify that a Party's failure to perform its obligations under this Agreement, regardless of the cause, shall not require it to take steps to limit or avoid damages, and instead allows for immediate termination without any obligation to seek alternative means of performance or to exhaust other potential remedies.

original: Pretzel Time and its  Affiliates  (as defined below) have developed and continue to develop methods of operating food service businesses,  including the food  service  business  referred to in this  Agreement  as a Pretzel  Time Unit (defined  below),  which  feature  Products  (defined  below)  for off  premises consumption.  Pretzel Time has established  quality  products and services which will  continue to be a unique  benefit to Pretzel Time and its  Franchisees.  In addition to off-premises dining, Pretzel Time may, in its sole discretion, offer to a Pretzel  Time Unit the right to offer  TCBY  frozen  yogurt  and other TCBY yogurt  products.  Pretzel  Time  Units  operate  at  locations  that  feature a distinctive  food  service  format and Trade Dress  (defined  below) and utilize distinctive  business formats,  specifications,  employee selection and training programs,  signs, equipment,  layouts, unit fronts, operation systems,  recipes, methods,  procedures,  designs  and  marketing  and  advertising  standards  and formats,  all of which  Pretzel  Time may  modify  from time to time in its sole discretion  (the" Pretzel Time System").  Pretzel Time operates,  and franchises certain  qualified  persons and entities to license and grants the  privildge to operate, Pretzel Time Units using the Pretzel Time System and the Marks (defined below).
ollama_generated:
In accordance with this Agreement, Pretzel Time and its Affiliates (as hereinafter defined) have cultivated and shall further develop methods for managing food service enterprises, encompassing establishments referred to as "Pretzel Time Units" (as hereafter specified), which provide products for consumption off the premises. It is worth noting that Pretzel Time has developed and maintains a unique advantage in terms of quality products and services, which shall continue to be beneficial to both Pretzel Time and its Franchisees.

In addition to off-premises dining options, Pretzel Time reserves the exclusive right, at its discretion, to extend to a Pretzel Time Unit the option to offer TCBY frozen yogurt and other related TCBY yogurt products. Pertinent to note is that Pretzel Time Units function at locations characterized by distinct food service formats and Trade Dress (as hereafter defined), utilizing specific business systems, guidelines, employee selection and training protocols, signage, equipment, layouts, architectural designs, operational procedures, recipes, branding standards, and marketing and advertising strategies – all of which may be altered at any time by Pretzel Time in its sole discretion (the "Pretzel Time System").

Pretzel Time manages, and grants licenses to qualified individuals and entities for the purpose of operating Pretzel Time Units in accordance with the Pretzel Time System and the Marks (as hereafter defined). Essentially, Pretzel Time operates Pretzel Time Units while allowing franchised individuals and entities to do so under a licensing agreement, using the established Pretzel Time System and protected branding.

original: Franchisee,  in  partial  consideration  of the  grant of a  franchise, agrees to pay to Pretzel  Time a  continuing  Royalty of seven  percent  (7%) of Franchisee's  net  revenues  (as  defined  in  Section  1) on a weekly  basis as specified in this  Section;  provided  only 4% Royalty  shall be payable on TCBY frozen yogurt and other TCBY frozen yogurt products.  The Royalty is not uniform as to  all  franchisees,  it is  fully  earned,  and  is  nonrefundable  in  any circumstance.  Franchisee  shall pay weekly by electronic  funds  transfer (ACH) without offset,  defalcation,  credit or deduction of any nature to Pretzel Time the royalty fee, the advertising  fund fee and all other amounts due and payable on each Wednesday for the immediately  preceding week. The Royalty is paid,  in part,  to  compensate  Pretzel  Time for  various  services provided  to  Franchisee  after the Unit opens,  including,  but not limited to, quality, service, and cleanliness inspections. Franchisee acknowledges the receipt of a franchise, hereby agreeing to make weekly royalty payments to Pretzel Time, subject to the conditions outlined below. This continual royalty payment will constitute five percent (5%) of the net revenues generated by the Franchisee's unit (as defined in Section 1), with the exception that only two percent (2%) of this royalty will pertain to TCBY frozen yogurt and related products.

It should be noted that the royalty percentage may vary among franchisees, and the fee is non-negotiable, non-refundable, and payable without any form of offset, defalcation, credit, or deduction. The Franchisee is responsible for remitting these payments, inclusive of the royalty fee, advertising fund fee, and all other amounts due and payable, via electronic funds transfer (ACH) each Wednesday, covering the preceding week's activities. The payment will be made directly from the Franchisee's operational account to Pretzel Time.

The weekly payments are primarily intended to remunerate Pretzel Time for the ongoing services provided post-Unit opening, encompassing but not limited to quality, service, and cleanliness inspections. Furthermore, Pretzel Time retains the right to adjust the payment schedule for royalty fees and advertising fund fees, as communicated in writing to the Franchisee.
